meanings.definition: A post or upright bar on either side of a door.
meanings.sent1: The doorpost stood tall and sturdy beside the entrance.
meanings.sent2: She leaned against the doorpost while waiting for her friend.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to climb the doorpost but failed comically.
meanings.sent4: His determination was as solid as a doorpost, unwavering in the face of challenges.
meanings.sent5: The old wooden doorpost creaked with every movement, echoing through the hallway.

meanings.definition: The side post of a doorway.
meanings.sent1: The doorpost was painted a vibrant red to match the front door.
meanings.sent2: He noticed a spiderweb in the corner of the doorpost.
meanings.sent3: The doorpost seemed to be playing hide-and-seek with the sunlight, casting shadows all around.
meanings.sent4: Her memories were etched into the doorpost, each mark telling a different story.
meanings.sent5: The doorpost marked the boundary between the cozy indoors and the bustling outdoors.
